text: Related to bug 19991. We tried to use mod_webapp under Apache2 and Tomcat 4.1.24. It doesn't work properly, you aren't able to recover certificate from Apache (and SSLOptions +StdEnvVars +... is activated). This works properly under Apache 1.3 and Tomcat 4.1.12, we haven't tested Apache 1.3 and Tomcat 4.1.24 yet. Thanks.
creator: drodriguez@divisait.com

text: mod_webapp is deprecated and unsupported. (Due to lack of developer interest)
creator: funkman@joedog.org
drodriguez@divisait.com
text:
Just as information...

We have tried with Tomcat 4.1.24 and it apparently works with Apache 1.3.27, so 
it's a mod_webapp.so, mod_ssl.so feature.

If it's unsupported, it should be very grateful if Tomcat team drop this 
connector from Jakarta-tomcat-connectors-4.1.

On the other hand, I think that is GRAVE that the supported connector JK2 
doesn't work proplery with SSL.

I share your concern. However, I have a very hard time understanding your other
bug report, because of bad English; I think I did understand it, but I'm not
sure. IMO you should rephrase it.
creator: remm@apache.org
drodriguez@divisait.com
text:
First of all, excuse me for my poor english, I wrote the previous message very 
quickly, so... I hope that you could understand it better now.

You can follow the other bug in #19991

Thanks.
